result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny D. Rainey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny D. Rainey

defendant.name: Rainey, Johnny D.
defendant.address: PO Box 413, W2726 Whitetail Lane, Montello, WI 53949

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnny D. Rainey in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant appears without counsel today; the defendant did not appear for the pre-trial conference.  Defendant states that he appeared the next morning and talked with the DA.  Atty Hendee apologizes and states that he did meet with him then and an offer was provided.  Defendant would like to accept the offer.
Court will recess to give the defendant time to fill out the paperwork.
Back on the record:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
Defendant will pay today
Return date on March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.

Defendant Johnny D. Rainey in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance  Return date scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
